Title:
Taxonomy and phylogeny of the brown-rot fungi: Postia and its
related genera
Keywords:
Fomitopsidaceae, Multi-marker analyses, Phylogeny,
Taxonomy, Wood-inhabiting fungi
Abstract:
Phylogenetic and taxonomic studies on the brown-rot fungi,
Postia and its related genera, are carried out. Based on multiple loci
DNA sequences including the internal transcribed spacer (ITS) regions,
the large subunit nuclear ribosomal RNA gene (nLSU), the small subunit
nuclear ribosomal RNA gene (nSSU), the small subunit mitochondrial rRNA
gene (mtSSU), the translation elongation factor 1-Î± gene (tef1), the
largest subunit of RNA polymerase II (rpb1) and the second subunit of
RNA polymerase II (rpb2), our phylogeny recognizes ten distantly related
clades of Postia sensu lato. Four new genera, Amaropostia, Calcipostia,
Cystidiopostia and Fuscopostia, are established, nine new species,
Amaropostia hainanensis, Cyanosporus fusiformis, C. microporus, C.
mongolicus, C. piceicola, C. subhirsutus, C. tricolor, C. ungulatus and
Postia sublowei, are identified. Illustrated descriptions of the new
genera and species are described. Identification keys to Postia and its
related genera, as well as keys to the species of each genus are
provided.
